etomica.math.geometry

Class Hypersphere

  • java.lang.Object
    • etomica.math.geometry.Hypersphere
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Shape, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Circle, Sphere

    public class Hypersphere
extends java.lang.Object
implements Shape, java.io.Serializable
    An arbitrary-dimension sphere.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected double radius 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Hypersphere(int D)
      Creates hypersphere of the given dimension, positioned at the origin.
      Hypersphere(int D, double radius)
      Creates hypersphere of the given dimension and radius, positioned at the origin.

    • Method Detail

      • getVolume

        public double getVolume()
        Description copied from interface: Shape
        Returns the (hyper-)volume of the enclosed region. In 1D this is a length, in 2D it is an area, in 3D it is a volume.
        Specified by:
        getVolume in interface Shape

      • D

        public final int D()
        Description copied from interface: Shape
        Returns the spatial dimension of the shape. For example, D = 2 for a square, D = 3 for a cube.
        Specified by:
        D in interface Shape

      • contains

        public boolean contains(IVector r)
        Returns true if the given point lies on or in the sphere.
        Specified by:
        contains in interface Shape
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassCastException - if given vector is not an instance of a D-dimensional vector

      • getRadius

        public double getRadius()
        Returns:
        Returns the radius.

      • setRadius

        public void setRadius(double radius)
        Parameters:
        radius - The radius to set.

      • getPosition

        public IVector getPosition()
        Returns:
        Returns the vector (not a copy) used to represent the position of the sphere.

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(IVector position)
        Description copied from interface: Shape
        Sets the position of the shape, which typically represents some central point within it. Specific definition depends on the definition of the shape.
        Specified by:
        setPosition in interface Shape
        Parameters:
        position - The new position, which is copied to an internal vector.
